DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this work is to compare the effectiveness of vaginal versus sub-lingual misoprostol for medical treatment of first trimester missed miscarriage.
DOC.brief_title: Sublingual Versus Vaginal Misoprostol In Medical Treatment of First Trimestric Missed Miscarriage
DOC.detailed_description: In women with first trimetric-missed miscarriage, sublingual misoprostol may be as vaginal misoprostol in achievement of successful miscarriage so our aim was to compare the effectiveness of vaginal versus sub-lingual misoprostol for medical treatment of first trimester missed miscarriage.
DOC.criteria: All women above 18 years of age Less than 12 weeks of gestation. Pregnancy is confirmed by pregnancy test or ultrasound scan. missed abortion Normal general and gynecological examination. The size of the uterus on pelvic examination was compatible with the estimated duration of pregnancy Hemodynamically unstable. Suspected sepsis with temperature 38 Â°C. Concurrent medical illness e.g. hematological, cardiovascular, thromboembolism, respiratory illnesses, recent liver disease or pruritus of pregnancy. Presence of intrauterine contraceptive device (IUCD). Suspect or proven ectopic pregnancy. Failed medical or surgical evacuation before presentation. Known allergy to misoprostol.
